Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) have been considered as one of the most efficient power generators that can directly convert chemical energy in the natural gas, biomas, or coal-derived gas to electrical energy.
Titulo: Effects of PH3 and CH3Cl Contaminants on the Performance of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Various contaminants in syngas are capable to cause catalyst malfunction and cell performance drop, limiting fuel cell to a wide application.
Titulo: Effects of PH3 and CH3Cl Contaminants on the Performance of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The effects of PH3 and CH3Cl fuel impurities on the electrochemical performance of SOFCs arc investigated a it various testing conditions.
Titulo: Effects of PH3 and CH3Cl Contaminants on the Performance of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Performance drop caused by the addition of 10 ppm PH3 remains identical in pure hydrogen and simulated coal-derived syngas at 750 degrees C, but a slight increase is observed when the cells are fueled syngas at 850 degrees C.
Titulo: Effects of PH3 and CH3Cl Contaminants on the Performance of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The presence of CH3Cl in syngas causes cell degradation to a larger extent at 850 degrees C. Moreover, the cooperative influences of PH3 and CH3Cl impurities in hydrogen are also studied at 750, 800, and 850 degrees C.
Titulo: Effects of PH3 and CH3Cl Contaminants on the Performance of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The addition of CH3Cl can stop and remove PH3 poisoning behavior, which is associated with each contaminant concentrations and operational temperatures.
Titulo: Effects of PH3 and CH3Cl Contaminants on the Performance of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The related mechanism has been deeply analyzed and diagnosed.
Titulo: Effects of PH3 and CH3Cl Contaminants on the Performance of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
